0.1994). + Next, a line from (0.75, 0.1994) to (0, 0.1994). + End with a line from (0, 0.1994) to (0, 0). + Ensure the loop is closed and no gaps exist between lines. **Coordinate System for the Next lines. **Coordinate System for the Next Part** * Translate the coordinate system to (0, 0.0997, 0.0884). **Intermediate Part 3** **Shape and Dimensions** * Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. * Length: 0.718 units * Width: 0.718 units * Height: 0.046 units **Instructions** * With the previous coordinate system, draw the first face: + Start with a line from (0, 0) to (0.7183, 0). + Continue with a line from (0.7183, 0) to (0.7183, 0.0997). + Next, a line from (0.7183, 0.0997) to (0, 0.0997). + End with a line from (0, 0.0997) to (0, 0). + Ensure the loop is closed and no gaps exist between lines. **Final Assembly Coordinate System** * Set the Euler angles to [0, 0, 0] and translate the coordinate system to the desired location for the final assembly.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with Curved Top** *Shape and Dimensions* Construct a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a curved top and a flat bottom. The top and bottom edges are straight, and the top edge is curved. The dimensions are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.0999 units (top curved portion) *Building the Coordinate System* The 2D sketch for this part will be created in a new coordinate system with no rotation or translation. *Drawing the 2D Sketch* Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Draw the straight edges and the curved top as follows: 1. Line 1: Draw a line from point (0, 0) to point (0.6993, 0). 2. Line 2: Draw a line from point (0.6993, 0) to point (0.6715, 0.2835). 3. Line 3: Draw a line from point (0.6715, 0.2835) to point (0.4832, 0.3504). 4. Line 4: Draw a line from point (0.4832, 0.3504) to point (0.4832, 0.4503). 5. Line 5: Draw a line from point (0.4832, 0.4503) to point (0.6562, 0.5502). 6. Line 6: Draw a line from point (0.6562, 0.5502) to point (0.6562, 0.75). 7. Line 7: Draw a line from point (0.6562, 0.75) to point (0.4942, 0.75). 8. Line 8: Draw a line from point (0.4942, 0.75) to point (0.3839, 0.6343). 9. Line 9: Draw a line from point (0.3839, 0.6343) to point (0.1242, 0.6343). 10. Line 10: Draw a line from point (0.1242, 0.6343) to point (0, 0.3397). 11. Line 11: Draw a line from point (0, 0.3397) to point (0, 0). *Closing the Loop* The points (0, 0) and (0.6993, 0) are the endpoints of Line 1, and they will be connected to close the loop. The 2D sketch is now complete, and it contains 11 lines forming a closed loop. *Creating the 3D sketch* 1. Scaling the 2D Sketch: Apply the scaling factor of 0.75 to all dimensions of the 2D sketch to create the scaled 2D sketch. 2. Transforming the 2D Sketch: - Euler Angles: Set the euler angles to (0, 0, 0) to maintain the original orientation. - Translation vector: Set the translation vector to (0, 0, 0) to maintain the original position. *Extruding the 2D sketch* Extrude the scaled and transformed 2D sketch to create the 3D model with these parameters: - Extrude depth toward normal: 0.0999 units - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 units - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body The first part of the CAD model, a rectangular prism with a curved top, is now complete.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1 with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] The sketch for this part has one face (face\\_1) with two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2). For face\\_1, the first loop (loop\\_1) consists of: - arc\\_1: Starting at [0.0046, 0.0046], with a midpoint at [0.0014, 0.0014], ending at [0.0046, 0.0]. - line\\_1: Starting at [0.0046, 0.0], ending at [0.0453, 0.0]. - arc\\_2: Starting at [0.0453, 0.0], with a midpoint at [0.0486, 0.0014], ending at [0.05, 0.0046]. - line\\_2: Starting at [0.05, 0.0046], ending at [0.05, 0.0453]. - arc\\_3: Starting at [0.05, 0.0453], with a midpoint at [0.0486, 0.0486], ending at [0.0453, 0.05]. - line\\_3: Starting at [0.0453, 0.05], ending at [0.0046, 0.05]. - arc\\_4: Starting at [0.0046, 0.05], with a midpoint at [0.0014, 0.0486], ending at [0.0, 0.0453]. - line\\_4: Starting at [0.0, 0.0453], ending at [0.0, 0.0046]. The second loop (loop\\_2) is identical to loop\\_1, but shifted up by 0.0076 along the Y-axis. Extrude the sketch along the normal vector with the following properties: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.75 - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.05 - Operation: Create a new solid body. This part has a length: 0.05, width: 0.05, and height: 0.75.</description>

<description>**Part 1: Constructing a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.1773, 0.2433]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5871, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.5871, 0.0], End Point [0.5871, 0.4576] + Line 3: Start Point [0.5871, 0.4576], End Point [0.0, 0.4576] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4576], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The sketch is now complete. Scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.5871. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by rotating it using the euler angles and translating it using the translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal by a depth of 0.1773 to create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions of the prism are as follows: length = 0.5871, width = 0.1773, height = 0.5871. **Part 2: Constructing a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and sloped side** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.3176, 0.1773, 0.0]. Next, create a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2858, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.2858, 0.0], End Point [0.2858, 0.2433] + Line 3: Start Point [0.2858, 0.2433], End Point [0.0, 0.2433] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2433], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Create a second 2D sketch on face 2 of the coordinate system. * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.2433], End Point [0.2858, 0.2433] + Line 2: Start Point [0.2858, 0.2433], End Point [0.2858, 0.4658] + Line 3: Start Point [0.2858, 0.4658], End Point [0.0, 0.4658] + Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.4658], End Point [0.0, 0.2433] The sketches are now complete. Scale both sketches using a scaling parameter of 0.4658. Transform the 2D sketches into 3D sketches by rotating them using the euler angles and translating them using the translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the first 3D sketch along the normal by a depth of 0.5727 to create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Extrude the second 3D sketch opposite the normal by a depth of 0.5727 to create a sloped side on the prism. The dimensions of the prism are as follows: length = 0.4658, width = 0.5727, height = 0.4658. The assembly is now complete, resulting in a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom and a sloped side.</description>

prompt: <description>**Intermediate Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Central Circular Hole** The first part is a rectangular prism with a central circular hole.
